constituent: gold, metal, gold, umbrella, drop, king, jewel, ball, drop2
heisigComment: * As a primitive, it means not only gold but any metal at all.
heisigStory: If this were not one of the most common characters you will ever have to write, I would apologize for having to give the explanation that follows. Anyway, we want to depict bars of gold bullion with an umbrella overhead to shade them from the heat (and perhaps to hide them as well). The bullion is made by melting down all the scepters of the kingdom, drop by drop, and shaping them into bars.
koohiiStory1: The fat king taking up the whole space under the umbrella actually isn´t fat - he just has two big gold bars hidden under his clothes.
koohiiStory2: Under the umbrella´s shade, the king sang, " Drop it to the left, drop it to the right, give me all the GOLD in sight!".
readingExamples: 金属 (きんぞく), 金銭 (きんせん), 純金 (じゅんきん), 金 (かね)
